title: Psychiatric Technician Interview

title: Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services
Interview Descriptions:
It was a relaxed conversation with the director, very open to questions. I was asked back for a second interview shortly after. The director purposefully left me to talk to various staff in an informal lunch, without her there so that they could be honest with me about the place.  

The longest part came after the interview and offer were over. It is a 3 month process to get credentialed that involves a lot of paperwork. Part of that is about dealing with the company bureaucracy, part is about background checks, etc. that are always a part of this work and most is about dealing with the nightmare of modern insurance credentialing (not Pine Rest's fault). Not a huge deal if you're not in a rush to start...for me, having some time to transition is a good thing.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions for the most part.

title: Support Staff Interview

Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fair. I came in dressed nice, yet I believe you should at least dress professionally. I came in with a tie and a nice shirt. Hair was groomed and I looked neat. Yet, I did not have previous patient experience, and I believe that was a major factor in what they were looking for. So I eventually did not get the position that I desired for, which is ok.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services (Grand Rapids, MI)
Interview Descriptions:
This was the worst interview I have ever had in my life. I was told that I was being interviewed for an online therapy position.  I had extensive conversations over the phone with two different people including the person running that program regarding the online therapy position, I was applying specifically for that position. They asked if I would be willing to do a follow-up interview in person at the Northwest Clinic. 

There were two people conducting the interview and one was quiet and one was very unpleasant. When I explained that I had talked to someone about the online position and that I was coming into interview for that, I was told they didn't have enough clients for that position and they might never have enough clients for online therapy.  To me this was very odd, as a therapist who works online part of the time, that is a thriving field and I have a very full caseload. 

I was told that the position that they had was a contracted therapist position in person at that clinic. I was really confused at that point and I must have looked puzzled, because the interviewer asked me if there was something wrong. I wasn't even sure what to say, so I mentioned that  I lived on the other side of town and I stated that I didn't know I was interviewing for an in-person position and that being from the other side of town that was quite a drive for me. The interviewer was very cold at that point and stated that I didn't need to finish the interview and that she lived over near my area (she was not that close to where I lived, but this girl was making a lot of assumptions).   I told them I might still be interested and asked them to please tell me more about the position. It felt surreal but I was trying to stay positive. I was told that this was a contracted position and that the pay was $40.00 an hour. My face must have shown a little shock at that number because they told me that obviously wasn't enough money for me and that the interview was over.  During the telephone conversation I had, I was given a much higher number and was told that this was a salaried position, with the opporutnity to see additional clients for additional pay. As a hard worker I had excited about that.  I  was quite shocked by the rude tone and the interviewer's attempts to assume my thoughts by 'reading' my facial expressions. It wasn't professional. 

I spent 10 years in public service, working as a therapist with high risk clients. I had an excellent resume and excellent references. Pine Rest has a great reputation, so I was excited to be applying for a position with them. At the very least I expected a courteous interview and a professional atmosphere. I was really disappointed. This is a big organization and I have had multiple postive interactions with their various programs over the years but I would never, ever even refer a client to this particular clinic. I think something has gone wrong there.
Interview Questions: They didn't really bother to ask questions.

title: RN Interview

title: PCP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Generic questions. They're so desperate for employees, they'll practically hire anyone. Just prepare for standard questions. Here are some more words, so I meet the minimum required amount. And I guess I'll add even more here...

title: Position On Human Resources Team Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted fairly soon after applying for the position. There was an initial phone interview with the recruiter where I was asked typical questions and for a sort-of run down of my interest and experience. I came in the following week for an in-person interview with the HR team (4 people), and they were all very nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: The people interviewing me actually had a long list of pretty detailed questions, many that took some serious on-the-spot thinking back to specific situations. This was kind of difficult because it's hard to remember specific situations from several years ago, but as long as you have a solid understanding of you past experiences, you should be okay.

title: Patient Care Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, immediately got a call from a recruiter to set up an interview for about a week later. Interviewed with two hiring managers for about 15 mins. The questions were entirely based on the work of the employees, not the stupid "tell me about a time" questions. All the questions were relevant to the work on the job. The most important one was about how you would handle a potentially dangerous situation with an agitated patient. I got that question from every behavioral health facility I interviewed in.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation in which a patient became agitated and threatening toward you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services (Grand Rapids, MI) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions:
A few weeks after I applied I received a phone call and an impromptu phone interview with the staffing office. It was a very basic interview (i.e. Why do you want to work for Pine Rest?, What experience do you have?). During that same phone call I was scheduled for an in-person interview with the nurse manager of the unit. I met with her a few days later. She asked me some of the same questions, in addition to others such as:
Would you be comfortable retraining a patient if necessary?
Give examples of an adverse work environment that you have experienced and how you handled this?
Why should we hire you?

It was a pretty easy interview. She offered me the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: Are you looking elsewhere for a job?
